name: Revive/check contours' containing rectangles
description: Recalculate all containing rectangles, stored in the contour array. Usually it is not necessary, because all functions, creating contour array, always store there correct minimal containing rectangles for every contour. However, it may be useful, if the contour array was modified manually or by some non-standard way.

in_ports.name: contours
in_ports.hint: Existing contours: serialized array of several contours.

out_ports.name: contours
out_ports.hint: The same contours with guaranteed correct containing rectangles.

out_ports.name: changed
out_ports.hint:
[Optional] The boolean flag:
false, if the result contours are identical to the source,
or true in other case (some rectangles really were revived).

out_ports.caption: some rectangles were incorrect
out_ports.name: were_incorrect
out_ports.hint:
[Optional] The boolean flag:
false, if all containing rectangles in the source array did really contain the contours (but, maybe, were too large),
or true in other case (some rectangles were incorrect: they did not actually contain corresponding contours).

controls.name: throwExceptionIfChanged
controls.caption: Throw exception if changed
controls.description: If set, this function throws an exception, if it changed something, i.e. if some containing rectangles really needed to be recalculated. Can be set to check, that some correctly built contour array was not damaged.
